exdpy.common module¶

class exdpy.common.LineType(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Enum of Line Type.

Line Type shows what type of a line is, such as message line or start line.

Lines with different types contain different information and have to be treated accordingly.

END = 'end'¶

Error Line Type

Used when error occurrs on recording.

Used in both server-side error and client-side (our client who receive WebSocket data) error.

ERROR = 'err'¶
MESSAGE = 'msg'¶

Send Line Type.

Message send from one of our client when recording.

SEND = 'send'¶

Start Line Type

Indicates the first line in the continuous recording.

START = 'start'¶

End Line Type.

Indicates the end line in the continuous recording.

class exdpy.common.TextLine(exchange: str, type: exdpy.common.LineType, timestamp: int, channel: Optional[str], message: Optional[str])¶

Bases: tuple

Data structure of a single line from a response.

exchange, type and timestamp is always present, but `channel` or `message` is not. This is because with certain type, a line might not contain channel or message, or both.

channel: Optional[str]¶

Message. Could be None accoring to type.

exchange: str¶

If type === LineType.MESSAGE, then a line is a normal message. All of value are present. You can get an assosiated channel by channel, and its message by message.

If type === LineType.SEND, then a line is a request server sent when the dataset was recorded. All of value are present, though you can ignore this line.

If type === LineType.START, then a line marks the start of new continuous recording of the dataset. Only channel is not present. message is the URL which used to record the dataset. You might want to initialize your work since this essentially means new connection to exchange’s API.

If type === LineType.END, then a line marks the end of continuous recording of the dataset. Other than type and timestamp are not present. You might want to perform some functionality when the connection to exchange’s API was lost.

If type === LineType.ERROR, then a line contains error message when recording the dataset. Only channel is not present. message is the error message. You want to ignore this line.

message: Optional[str]¶

Alias for field number 4

timestamp: int¶

Channel name which this line is associated with. Could be None according to type.

type: exdpy.common.LineType¶

Timestamp in nano seconds of this line was recorded.

Timestamp is in unixtime-compatible format (unixtime * 10^9 + nanosec-part). Timezone is UTC.

exdpy.http module¶

class exdpy.http.HTTPModule(client_setting: exdpy.common._ClientSetting)¶

Bases: object

filter(exchange: str, channels: List[str], minute: Union[int, str, datetime.datetime], formt: Optional[str] = None, start: Optional[Union[int, str, datetime.datetime]] = None, end: Optional[Union[int, str, datetime.datetime]] = None, postFilter: Optional[List[str]] = None) → List[exdpy.common.TextLine]¶

Sends a request to Filter HTTP Endpoint with given parameter synchronously.

Parameters

  • exchange – Name of exchange.

  • channels – List of name of channels.

  • minute – Target minutes in UNIX time.

  • formt – Name of format to get response in.

  • start – Minimum time including the time to filter-in lines in nano second UNIX time.

  • end – Maximum time excluding the time to filter-in lines in nano second UNIX time.

Returns

List of lines as an response.

snapshot(exchange: str, channels: List[str], at: Union[int, str, datetime.datetime], formt: Optional[str] = None, postFilter: Optional[List[str]] = None) → List[exdpy.http.Snapshot]¶

Sends a request to Snapshot HTTP Endpoint with given parameter synchronously.

Parameters

  • exchange – Name of exchange to take snapshot of

  • channels – List of names of channels to take snapshot of

  • at – Target time to take snapshot at

  • formt – Format to get result in

Returns

List of snapshots

exdpy.raw module¶

class exdpy.raw.RawRequest¶

Bases: object

Replays market data in raw format.

You can pick the way to read the response: - download() to immidiately start downloading the whole response as one array in the synchronous way. - stream() to return iterable object yields line by line.

download(concurrency: int = 20) → List[exdpy.common.TextLine]¶
stream(buffer_size: int = 20) → Iterable[exdpy.common.TextLine]¶
exdpy.raw.raw(apikey: str, filt: Mapping[str, List[str]], start: Union[int, str, datetime.datetime], end: Union[int, str, datetime.datetime], postFilter: Mapping[str, List[str]], formt: Optional[str] = None, timeout: float = 30.0) → exdpy.raw.RawRequest¶

exdpy.replay module¶

class exdpy.replay.ReplayRequest¶

Bases: object

download() → List[exdpy.common.MappingLine]¶

Send requests and download responses in an array.

All data will be lost if there was an error while downloading any part of the request, including when your API-key quota runs out.

Returns

List of lines

stream(buffer_size: int = 20) → Iterable[exdpy.common.MappingLine]¶

Send requests to the server and read responses by streaming.

Returns Iterable object yields a response line by line. Can be iterated by for-in sentence. The iterator yields a line immidiately if it is bufferred, but waits for it to be downloaded if not available.

Please note that buffering won’t start by calling this function, calling :func:`__iter__` of a returned iterable will.

Higher responsiveness than download() is expected as it does not have to wait for the entire date to be downloaded.

Parameters

buffer_size – Optional. Desired buffer size to store streaming data. One shard is equivalent to one minute.

Returns

Instance of class implements Iterable from which iterator that yields response line by line from buffer can be obtained.

exdpy.replay.replay(apikey: str, filt: Mapping[str, List[str]], start: Union[int, str, datetime.datetime], end: Union[int, str, datetime.datetime], timeout: float = 30.0)¶
